comments.raw_text: You can already obsolete your own attachments. Is that what you want to do?
comments.creator: mkanat@bugzilla.org
comments.text: You can already obsolete your own attachments. Is that what you want to do?

comments.author: sebbaz+ff@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
No, marking as obsolete still leaves the file accessible to the public.

I should have mentioned that this arose from a user who accidentally left some sensitive material in an attachment.

So the idea is to allow the originator to prevent public access to the attachment.

This could be done by actually removing the file.
Or by ensuring that there is no public access to it, even via the original attachment id (which is likely to be visible on a mailing list).
